# StreamCore Media Inc &  Alex |  Meeting

## Meeting Details

**Meeting ID:** b2eaf453-14f8-4571-9ca4-ea2c5a66a0ab

**Date & Time:** Wednesday, January 21, 2026 at 6:30 PM UTC

**Calendar Event ID:** ehc28domn8eoruhb9am9fp77bo

**Calendar Event Title:** StreamCore Media Inc &  Alex |  Meeting

**Organizer:** Alex Obleton (user@user)

### Attendees

- **Jd Rhoads** (user@user)
- **Alex Obleton** (user@user)

## My Notes

Flex rental solutions integration

Setup and teardown, conferences set up and tear down, they rent the equipment and we provide the labor, a lot of the labor is contracted, but they have full timers.

The system they use is Flex rental solutions, it's very industyr specific and it's open API, in 2019 they decided they are going to move all of their systems are open API, only use customers that have that capability

Quickbooks, ramp, Flex rental solutions - how we manage all that equipment and we quote customers, do we have that in invevntory

It has a variable that doesn't easly connect with other things, and that's time. Quantity amount and total, no time factor on everything, things come in and out of inventory asset management is used and available for builds for certain times and not

They're API is confusing, they've only been able to get programmers who get in at a very high level

A business owner out of vegas is using at. - Las Vegas Audio Visual - AV Vegas, they are currently using AutomateFlow their owner is the guy who told him they're using AutomateFlow so started diving this was a year ago, now we're back on the hunt on how we can use to talk to quick books and teamsup, calendar system

Ramp, expense

contacts.name: [Data Analyst - name unknown]
contacts.title: Has used AutomateFlow "a lot" per JD. James be hands-on-keyboard. Need to engage directly.

activityLog.description: Discovery call with JD Rhoads (owner). They run AV equipment rental for conferences. Core problem is integrating Flex Rental Solutions (industry-specific software) with QB, Ramp, TeamUp. Flex has an API but it's complex due to time-based inventory model. A competitor (AV Vegas) is using AutomateFlow with Flex - that's why JD is exploring us. He's been on a free trial, has a data analyst who knows AutomateFlow. Pricing not a concern - capabilities are. JD said "I don't think we're there" on enterprise but could be a Teams deal.

**Breakthrough** - Found that Flex Rental Solutions already built a AutomateFlow integration (private/invite-only). Developer is user@user AV Vegas got Flex to build this for them. JD just needs access to the invite link. Next: Send follow-up connecting JD to Roger at Flex.

doc_streamcore-media_follow-up-jd-2026-0.title: follow-up-jd-2026-01-21
doc_streamcore-media_follow-up-jd-2026-0.content:
Subject: Good news - Flex Rental Solutions already has a AutomateFlow integration



JD,



Did some digging after our call. Turns out Flex Rental Solutions already built a AutomateFlow integration - it's just private/invite-only, which is why you didn't see it in our app directory.



The developer on the Flex side is Roger (user@user). He can give you access to the integration link. I actually found this by looking at AV Vegas's setup - so you could also reach out to their owner to hear how it's been working for them.



Once you have access, your data analyst should be able to see Flex Rental Solutions as an available app in AutomateFlow and start building. No custom actions needed.



Happy to still do a working session once you're connected if that's useful, but this should unblock you.



Let me know how it goes with Roger.



Alex
